title: JOUR JOUR 390-0-25 Special Topics
topic: Media Innovation and Silicon Valley?s Startup Cult

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course is intended to be highly interactive. Attendance, punctuality, and quality class and field trip participation are critical and will be included in the course's final grade, as explained below in Section V. Students are expected to read all assigned materials in advance and to be prepared to discuss them in class, interacting with the instructors and guest lecturers. Makeup work for absences may be permitted at the instructors' discretion, but must be individually requested / negotiated. Students also are expected to participate in any trips scheduled during class time. The field trips are the most important part of the experience you will have in the Bay Area and Silicon Valley.

In addition, students must able to work both individually and collaboratively to complete assignments on time through reading, research, interviewing, and teamwork.

subject: JOUR
